qas.question: Who primarily initiated the clashes along the 38th parallel?
What group trained the Republic of Korea army?
What general had a lot of confidence in the Republic of Korea's army?
Who wanted to take over North Korea?
Who was the diplomat that visited Korea?

context: While these preparations were underway in the North, there were frequent clashes along the 38th parallel, especially at Kaesong and Ongjin, many initiated by <a0_0>the South<a0_0/>. The Republic of Korea Army (ROK Army) was being trained by the <a1_0>U.S. Korean Military Advisory Group<a1_0/> (KMAG). On the eve of war, KMAG's commander <a2_0>General William Lynn Roberts<a2_0/> voiced utmost confidence in the ROK Army and boasted that any North Korean invasion would merely provide "target practice". For his part, <a3_0>Syngman Rhee<a3_0/> repeatedly expressed his desire to conquer the North, including when American diplomat <a4_0>John Foster Dulles<a4_0/> visited Korea on 18 June.
